name: CacheEviction
documentation:
Represents an eviction from a {@link Cache}.

These events are typically emitted when a cached object is removed from memory due to expiration, memory pressure, manual eviction, or cache size constraints.

Eviction events are useful for metrics reporting and operational observability, particularly when monitoring cache hit/miss ratios and understanding retention behaviors under load.

Emitted events can be published to the metrics log via {@link CacheEvictionsLogger} and consumed downstream for alerts or analysis. @see CacheEvictionsLogger @see io.fluxzero.sdk.publishing.MetricsGateway

fields.name: id
fields.documentation: The identifier of the evicted object. May be null if the entire cache was cleared.

fields.name: value
fields.documentation: The value of the evicted object. Note: This may be null if the cache implementation supports soft references and the value has been removed from memory or after clearing of the entire cache.
